item.title: Report X-2024080333
item.description:
Report X-2024080333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 840669 in a wet, deteriorated state. Package was placed in a tote for QA. upon inspection, contents is a bottle of Decal stat that had a loose cap, causing its liquid content to spill out which in time deteriorated a small portion of the package. While the package had filling to prevent movement on the body, there was minimal to none for the cap, which if properly protected, would have not become loose during movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080317
item.description:
Report X-2024080317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was observed to be wet when package handler prepared to unload it from trailer. QA admin was called to the scene and placed the package in line HazMat tote. Aside from this carton being wet, there was little evidence of any spill inside trailer. No other packages were affected and admin cleaned up the area where the package had been with neutralizer as a precaution. Internal bottle had a loose cap, it also presents visually as having been crushed or compressed on opposite sides of the bottle, though there's no sign of the outer carton having been impacted adversely. Though the package carton presented wet, none of the bottles inside were, and the labeling on the bottles show no sign of having made contact with corrosive mixture. Body of bottle which lost content is intact, there is no sign of leakage there.

item.title: Report X-2024080238
item.description:
Report X-2024080238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging is wet at the top side of the box. A strong vinegary smell is coming out from the box as well. Inside, 12 qty of plastic bottles are each contained in a sealed plastic bag and separated by a slotted partition. The contents are 13 fl oz of Decon Spore 200 Plus chemicals. One of the bottle had a cap that had broken off in to two pieces. 12 fl ounces of the content have spilled out in to the plastic bag and some seeped out of it and made the exterior packaging wet.

item.title: Report E-2024080104
item.description:
Report E-2024080104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-12ft area of the trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a forklift damaging two (2) plastic jugs. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify only two (2) jugs were damaged, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs, and recovered material were placed into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and one (1) 16-gallon poly drum for disposal.

X-2024072450 Upon inspection of the package it was discovered that the box was wet from its top left corner. with further investigation and opening the box it was found that both bottles of zeps degreaser had been slowly leaking due to both of their caps not being properly secure. resulting in the internal leakage. 2. X-2024080022 upon inspection of the package it was discovered that the box was wet from its top left corner. with further investigation and opening the box it was discovered that both bottles of industrial degreaser had loose caps which resulted in their internal leakage.

  • Description: 1. X-2024072191 The package was found damaged by the venting of the closure allowing the tablet powder inside to seep out and damage the box. The package has a oxidizer sticker. 2. X-2024072192 The package was damaged when the cleaning product seeped out of the lid onto the box. The package had no paperwork to match the oxidizer sticker. 3. X-2024072193 The package was found torn and upon inspection, it was found that the product vented allowing the cleaner to damage the box. 4. X-2024072195 The package was found torn by the vented cleaning product inside. the closure seeped allowing the powder tablets inside to tear through the box. 5. X-2024072196 The package was found torn by the cleaning product inside and upon inspection the package seems to be a undeclared hazmat. 6. X-2024072213 attachment Name:thumbnail_IMG_5964.jpg
